panels.description:
Green = OK
Orange = Warning
Red = Error
panels.title: Health

panels.description: Total number of events currently in the MDS log. Events represent individual metadata operations (file creates, deletions, renames, etc.) that need to be journaled for consistency and recovery purposes.
panels.title: Total events

panels.description: Total number of log segments currently active. The MDS log is divided into segments for management purposes.
panels.title: Log Segments

panels.description: Number of events added to the log. This increments each time a new metadata operation is journaled, indicating the rate of new operations being logged.
panels.title: Log events added

panels.description: Number of log events that have been replayed during MDS recovery or startup. This indicates how much journal replay was needed, typically after an unclean shutdown or failover.
panels.title: Replayed Log events

panels.description: Number of log segments that have been added/created. This tracks the rate of new segment creation.
panels.title: Log Segments Added

panels.description: Number of events expired from the log. Events are expired when they're no longer needed for recovery (typically after being committed to the backing store).
panels.title: Expired events

panels.description: Number of events expired due to being too old (aged out). This happens when events have been in the log longer than configured retention periods.
panels.title: Expired events due to retention

panels.description: Number of log segments that have expired and been removed from active use.
panels.title: Log Segments Expired

panels.description: Number of events trimmed from the log. This is the total count of events that have been removed from the log for any reason.
panels.title: Trimmed events

panels.description: Number of events expired due to log growing too large. When the log exceeds size limits, older events are purged to make room for new ones.
panels.title: Expired events due to size

panels.description: Total number of log segments that have been trimmed/removed from the log.
panels.title: Log Segments Trimmed
